alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; Northern Lancaster; Southern Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 4:58AM EST until January 09 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM EST THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Chesterfield, Northern Lancaster and Southern Lancaster. * WHEN...From 10 AM EST this morning through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A strong low pressure system will move through the area today producing heavy rain at times with rainfall totals between 1.5 and 2.5 inches. With this area experiencing the most rain in the past 30 days, conditions may be more favorable for flash flooding, especially in poor drainage areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
